intro: Dissochaeta setosa, commonly known as the hairy dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. Dissochaeta setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
